title: Here is why Rahul Dravid slept in the Economy class during India's triumphant return
summary: During Team India's return flight after winning the T20 World Cup in Barbados, head coach Rahul Dravid chose to sleep in Economy class, letting players take Business class seats. This humble gesture came after India's historic victory that coincided with Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma's T20 retirement.
content:
India's thrilling T20 World Cup victory in Barbados on June 29th marked the end of a long, arduous wait for an ICC title. The win was especially sweet as it coincided with the retirement of cricketing legends Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma from the T20 format.

During the team's return flight to India, an interesting incident caught everyone's attention. Head coach Rahul Dravid, known for his humility and down-to-earth nature, chose to sleep in Economy class while ensuring all team members had comfortable Business class seats. This gesture perfectly exemplified Dravid's leadership style and his prioritization of player comfort over his own.

The decision resonated with fans and cricket enthusiasts worldwide, reminding everyone why Dravid is often called "The Wall" not just for his batting prowess but also for his strength of character and leadership qualities.

## Team's Historic Victory
India's thrilling T20 World Cup victory in Barbados on June 29th marked the end of a long, arduous wait for an ICC title. The win was especially sweet as it coincided with the retirement of cricketing legends Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma from the T20 format.

## Leadership by Example
During the team's return flight to India, an interesting incident caught everyone's attention. Head coach Rahul Dravid, known for his humility and down-to-earth nature, chose to sleep in Economy class while ensuring all team members had comfortable Business class seats. This gesture perfectly exemplified Dravid's leadership style and his prioritization of player comfort over his own.

The decision resonated with fans and cricket enthusiasts worldwide, reminding everyone why Dravid is often called "The Wall" not just for his batting prowess but also for his strength of character and leadership qualities.
